intro: Calycorectes teixeireanus, commonly known as the Brazilian starfish plant, is a rare and unique species native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that resemble those of sea stars. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with purple. Its flowers are typically violet to blue in color and bloom in clusters, adding a dramatic visual impact. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
